word:
When we went to Monterey last summer, for instance, you went into the river four times and not only disobeyed us yourself but led Willie to disobedience. A thorn has been planted in my heart from that time, when I became convinced that you could not be trusted. I am not easy any time, 


                                    -299- 

whether at home or abroad.--Letter 4, 1865, p. 4. (To Edson White, June 20, 1865.)
